resources.title: Demographic information
resources.subTitle: These questions collect basic demographic information, including age, gender, ethnicity, education, employment, and household makeup

content.text: 3. Please can you tell me how old you are?
4. What is your date of birth?
5. What was your age on your last birthday?
2. What is your ethnic group? I will read out the options. Please choose one option that best describes your ethnic group or background.
Which of the options on this card best describes how you think of yourself? Please just read out the number next to the description.
I will now read out a list of terms people sometimes use to describe how they think of themselves.
Which of the following options best describes how you think of yourself?
Which of the options on this card best describes how you think of yourself? Please just read out the number next to the description.
I will now read out a list of terms people sometimes use to describe how they think of themselves.
Which of the following options best describes how you think of yourself?
1. Have you been out of the UK since April 2020
2. Have you been outside of the UK since we last spoke to you?
4. Date last returned to the UK
5. Could you please tell us, if you have travelled over the Easter break?
No, stayed in my current accommodation
6. How many nights do you intend to stay in the UK?
7. What is the main reason for travel to the UK?
8. Is anyone else travelling with you?
Number in travelling group: Number of male adults: Number of female adults: Number of male children: Number of female children:
9. What country did you travel from?
10. What was the main reason for travelling abroad?
11. What was your reason for travelling to the UK?

subThemes.title: Frequency and purpose of travel (business, leisure, family)

content.text: 1. How well do you understand the requirements that are in place for those arriving in the UK? Would you say you have...
2. Overall, how easy or difficult did you find it to follow Coronavirus (COVID-19) regulations during your stay overseas?
3. How confident are you that you know how to access official information on Coronavirus (COVID-19) regulations for the UK?
4. Overall, how easy or difficult did you find it to follow Coronavirus (COVID-19) regulations during your stay overseas?
5. Where did you find information about quarantine requirements on returning from overseas or entering the UK? Select all that apply:
Departure countryâ€™s official website or documents
6. Overall, how easy or difficult did you find it to follow Coronavirus (COVID-19) regulations during your stay overseas?
7. During your stay, how satisfied were you with any measures implemented in the UK to reduce spreading the coronavirus infection?
8. Which of the following would you be willing to carry out when going on a trip abroad? Please select all that apply
Wearing a face covering while travelling to and from your destination
Providing proof that you have been vaccinated for the coronavirus (COVID-19)
Taking coronavirus (COVID-19) tests before and after travelling
Quarantining for 10 days after arriving home
Providing details of your accommodation, dates of travel and home address
9. What country did you travel from?
10. While you were using public transport in the last seven days, how many people did you see wearing protective face coverings to help slow the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19)?
11. During your stay, how satisfied were you with any measures implemented in the UK to reduce spreading the coronavirus infection?
12. While you were using public transport in the last seven days, how many people did you see wearing protective face coverings to help slow the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19)?
1. Is there anyone living with you who is sick, disabled, or over 70 whom you look after or give special help to?

2. Do you look after, or give any help or support to, anyone because they have long-term physical or mental health conditions or illnesses, or problems related to old age? Exclude anything you do as part of your paid employment.
Yes, 9 hours a week or less
Yes, 50 or more hours a week
3. Where does the person or people you help or support live?
4. Have you volunteered through an organisation in the last 4 weeks?

5. The next questions are about any regular activities you may have carried out to help someone. Exclude anything you do as part of your paid employment. In the past seven days, did you look after, or give any help or support to, anyone inside or outside your household because they have: Long-term physical or mental health conditionsIllnesses, or problems related to old age
Yes, less than 2 hours a week

6. In the past seven days, have you carried out any of the following activities to look after or help or support someone within or outside of your household, that was not part of your paid employment? Please select all that apply
Social support and assistance, for example, receiving telephone calls
Accompanying on errands, for example, shopping or appointments
Home and garden, for example, making meals or collecting shopping
Helping with paperwork or internet access for example utilities or benefits
7. We are interested to know about the impact of the recent coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak. Was the reason you were caring for someone in that week due to coronavirus (COVID-19)?
8. In what way was the care related to coronavirus (COVID-19)? Select all that apply:
Caring for a child whose school had closed due to coronavirus (COVID-19)
9.We are interested to know about the impact of the recent coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak. Was the reason you were caring for someone in that week due to coronavirus (COVID-19)?
10. In what way was the care related to coronavirus (COVID-19)? Select all that apply:
Caring for a child whose school had closed due to coronavirus (COVID-19)
11. Do you have care responsibilities for any of the people you may have had to avoid contact with?
